revised_title: The Case of Margaret Cutting: A Young Woman Who Speaks Without a Tongue
tldr: The article presents the case of Margaret Cutting, a young woman who lost her tongue due to cancer but still has the ability to speak and read fluently. Despite the absence of her tongue, she can also sing, distinguish tastes, and swallow both solids and liquids without any difficulty. The article discusses the examination and observations made by several individuals, including medical professionals, to understand the phenomenon and the role of the fleshy excrescence in her throat.
